definition: (of market prices etc) to rapidly fluctuate (idiom)/volatile/significant ups and downs/roller coaster
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Could a changing climate cause similarly big ebbs and flows?
sentences.chinese: 氣候變化是否同樣會引起移民浪潮大起大落？

sentences.english: Babys born or somebody dies, and thats a jerk.
sentences.chinese: 出生啊，死亡啊，這就是個大起大落。

sentences.english: This has been a really up-and-down week.
sentences.chinese: 這個星期真是大起大落。

sentences.english: In America, reputations come and go overnight and in the end usually does not matter.
sentences.chinese: 在美國，名譽一夕之間大起大落，最後不會那麼重要。

definition: valley/trough (as opposed to peaks)/fig. low point/lowest ebb/nadir of one's fortunes
to move up and down/to undulate/ups and downs
calligraphic flourish with many twists/fig. many twists and turns
shift in the trend of events/turnaround/plot shift in a book/turn in the conversation
bitterness finishes, sweetness begins (idiom); the hard times are over, the good times just beginning
